meanings.definition: The act of working together or in conjunction with another
meanings.sent1: The successful project was a result of the coaction between the team members.
meanings.sent2: Effective coaction among the students led to a well-organized presentation.
meanings.sent3: The coaction of the chef and the baker resulted in a delicious cake for the event.
meanings.sent4: The coaction of the gears in the clockwork symbolized unity and harmony.
meanings.sent5: The coaction of the ants carrying food showcased their teamwork and collaboration.

meanings.definition: The interaction or cooperation between two or more entities
meanings.sent1: The coaction between the two companies resulted in a successful merger.
meanings.sent2: The coaction of the bees in the hive ensures the survival of the colony.
meanings.sent3: The coaction of the planets in the solar system seemed like a cosmic dance.
meanings.sent4: The coaction of the waves crashing against the shore created a mesmerizing sight.
meanings.sent5: The coaction of the magnets demonstrated the principle of attraction and repulsion.
